bibl.title: Letter from Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon to George A. Kellogg, September 11, 1941

div1.p: Agramonte's daughter expresses her approval of the finished Cornwell painting and requests reproductions.

div1.head: Letter from Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon to George A. Kellogg, September 11, 1941
div1.opener:
Calle 15 No. 311,
Vedado, Habana, Cuba.
September 11, 1941
Mr. George A. Kellogg
257 Cornelison Avenue
Jersey City, New Jersey
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
I must ask you to excuse my delay in answering your kind letter
of July 24. I have been away on a vacation and, since my return, very
busy starting my school work again. Thanks very much for the clipping
from the Sunday Mirror with reproductions of “The Conquerors of Yellow
Fever” by Cornwell.

I am glad to be able to say that I think the finished painting
is worthy of high praise. The likenesses are much better than the pre-
vious sketches and, though naturally more symbolic than historical, the
composition, except for very slight discrepancies - truly remarkable.
I am not aware of the effect upon my compatriots, but I can heartily
congratulate you for my own sake on the general result. Some day, per-
haps, I hope, some honest historian will say the last word about that
great discovery. In the meantime you may feel satisfied that you have
done your bit towards keeping their memory alive.

I am certainly interested in having reproductions of your pictures.
The Biology room in the school I teach in (Ruston Academy, the best American
High School in Cuba) would like to frame one of them for their walls. My
father's sisters would surely love to have one and personally, I am looking
forward to having my own. Am I abusing your kind offer by so many demands?
Anyhow, I would be glad to pay any expenses if there should be any, to
obtain those three copies.

I hope Mr. Kellogg, to have the pleasure of making your acquaintance
at some date in the near future, should you happen to come our way again.
Please extend to the artist Cornwell my kind appreciation of his work and
believe me
div1.closer: Sincerely, (Signed) Estela Agramonte del Rodriguez Leon.
